extraction_metadata.focus: Hudson Johnson family completion (Agnes, Mary/Polly, Joel Shropshire), Rebecca Johnson/Hatcher connection, Walter Johnson Sullivan Co records, Larkin Johnson, Hiram Johnson, Isaac Johnson
extraction_metadata.notes: Final batch from this file. Completes Hudson Johnson's family (Tony's direct ancestor), adds Hatcher connection through Rebecca Johnson's son, documents additional Johnsons. More information on these individuals may come from future source files.

sources_to_add.full_citation: Big Creek Baptist Church Minutes, Washington County, North Carolina (now Hawkins County, Tennessee), c.1800.

sources_to_add.author: Rev. Donald J. Hebert
sources_to_add.title: Southwest Louisiana Records, Volume 1 - 1756-1910
sources_to_add.full_citation: Rev. Donald J. Hebert, 'Southwest Louisiana Records, Volume 1 - 1756-1910' (1974).
Dickson County, Tennessee, Deed from Abraham Caldwell to Lebius Richardson, 17 January 1809.
Humphreys County, Tennessee, Deed Book M, pp. 169-171, dated 20 November 1854.
Goochland County, Virginia, Order Books and Wills, 1744-1746.
Hanover County, Virginia, Road Order, 2 March 1721, p. 101.

documents.title: Big Creek Baptist Church - Agnes Johnson member, Hudson Johnson deacon
documents.transcription_excerpt: This is the Bunch Families found at Big Creek Baptist Church with rev. Thomas Murrell and Agness Johnston. Whose daughter if Mary Johnson married To Joel Shropshire... In 1800 era Hudson Johnson is a Deacon in this Church.
documents.notes: Hudson Johnson served as deacon at Big Creek Baptist Church c.1800. Wife Agnes was a member. Church formed by Rev. Thomas Murrell. Bunch families also members.

documents.title: St. Martin of Tours Church - Charles Jonson Hogans and Sara Hatcher
documents.transcription_excerpt: Charles Jonson Hogans, son of Homfrey (Humphrey) and Rebecca Jonson Hogan listed at St. Martin of Tours Church, St. Martinville, Louisiana. Here a Charles Jonson Hogans + Sara Hatcher gave birth to two daughters -- Prudence Hogans 8 January 1806 and Anne Hogans 22 June 1808.

people.notes: Son of Humphrey Hogan and Rebecca Johnson; 'of Bedford County, Virginia'
HATCHER connection - wife of Charles Jonson Hogans

locations.name: Bedford County
locations.notes: Charles stated he was 'of Bedford County, Virginia'

documents.notes: KEY DOCUMENT: Establishes Hatcher connection through Rebecca Johnson's grandson. Charles Jonson Hogan (son of Humphrey Hogan and Rebecca Johnson) married Sara Hatcher. This connects Johnson and Hatcher families.

documents.title: Sullivan County Militia List 1788 - Walter Johnson
documents.transcription_excerpt: 1788 Sullivan Co Miltia List From Historic Sullivan, Taylor, p 225, '...the Tennessee to Abingdon, Virginia road [now Hwy 81] includes what is now Hawkins [County] ... Walter JOHNSON, M ROWLER [Martin ROLLER?] Jr, John DEAN, John ANDERSON, David ERWIN among others

people.notes: Listed as 'M ROWLER Jr' - possibly Martin Roller

documents.notes: Walter Johnson on 1788 Sullivan County militia list. Area later included Hawkins County.

documents.title: Sullivan County Tax List 1796 - Walter Johnston Esq.
documents.transcription_excerpt: 1796 Sullivan Co. tax List JOHNSTON, Walter, esqr 260 acs 1 white poll, 3 black polls

people.notes: 260 acres, 1 white poll, 3 black polls; designated 'Esquire'

documents.notes: Walter Johnston listed as 'Esquire' - indicates status. Owned 260 acres, had 3 enslaved persons.

documents.title: Abraham Caldwell to Lebius Richardson - Hudson Johnson witness
documents.transcription_excerpt: January 17 1809 Hudson Johnson witness to a deed from Abraham Caldwell to Lebius Richardson tract of land on Barton's Creek, 200 acres Pd$450. Other witnesses were Joel Shropshire and Thomas Richardson.

people.notes: Husband of Mary Johnson (daughter of Hudson Johnson)

documents.notes: Hudson Johnson and son-in-law Joel Shropshire witness same deed - shows family connection and Bartons Creek location.

documents.title: James David Johnson Petition - Margaret Johnson estate
documents.transcription_excerpt: Found a deed in the Humphrey Co. Court House Deed Book M p.169,170,171 dated 20 Nov 1854 where James David Johnson is Petitioning to sell land of Margaret Johnson decd. in right of their father Hiram Johnson.

people.notes: Son of Hiram Johnson and Margaret Johnson

documents.notes: Establishes Hiram Johnson as father of James David Johnson, and Margaret as mother.

documents.title: Benjamin Johnson Estate - Isaac Johnson security
documents.transcription_excerpt: Goochland Co.: Elizabeth Johnson comes into court & makes oath that Benj. Johnson died without any will so far as she knows or believes & on her motion Certificate is granted her for obtaining Letters of Administration in due form. Isaac Johnson, William Arrington, Outring(??) Thompson security for same. Ordered that Philip Webber, George Payne, Thomas Wadlow, Robt Burton Junr. or any three of them being first sworn by Justices of the Peace do appraise the estate of Benj. Johnson, Decd.

people.notes: Robert Burton Jr. - BURTON family connection

documents.notes: Isaac Johnson posted security for Benjamin Johnson's estate. Robert Burton Jr. as appraiser connects to Burton family from Arrowhattocks extraction.

documents.title: Road Order 1721 - Isaac Johnson on Taylors Creek
documents.transcription_excerpt: In Obedience to an order of court dated the 2nd of March, 1721, its order'd that Samuel Knockols clear a road from the upper end of Mattlock's road to the upper Inhabitants, on the north Side of the South river, and the he have to assist him, Mr Thos Johnson's, Mr David Meriwwether's upper Quarter, Jn Bunch on Taylors Creek, Isaac Johnson, Jn Bostick, Mr. Rich Phillips, with all their Male Tithables

people.notes: Meriwether family - connected to Col. Richard Johnson per researcher note

documents.notes: Early Isaac Johnson record 1721. Listed with Thomas Johnson, John Bunch, David Meriwether. Tony's note: Meriwether families married to Col. Richard Johnson son of William Johnson and Contance Lucas.

family_groups_to_create.name: Hiram Johnson of Humphreys County
family_groups_to_create.summary: Hiram Johnson (d. 20 Nov 1844) married Margaret (b.1793 NC, d. 9 Sept 1850). Margaret did all land transactions - her name on deeds, not Hiram's. Lands on Tumbling Creek of Duck River. Both buried Cannon Cemetery on Ben Pewett farm, Tumbling Creek. Children include James David Johnson, Jackson Johnson (born Kentucky). DNA match to Timothy Rich line.

locations.evidence: Tony's research - wife of Hudson Johnson

new_people_to_create.evidence: Big Creek Baptist Church minutes; Tony L. Johnson's direct ancestor
new_people_to_create.notes: Wife of Hudson Johnson. Member of Big Creek Baptist Church with Rev. Thomas Murrell. Tony states he descends from 'Hudson Johnson and Agness Johnson of Bartons Creek, Dickson Co. Tn, Big Creek Hawkins Co Tn and Buffalo Creek of Henry Co. Va.'

new_people_to_create.evidence: Tony's research notes; husband Joel Shropshire witnessed deeds with Hudson Johnson
new_people_to_create.notes: Daughter of Hudson Johnson and Agnes Johnson. Married (1) Joel Shropshire, (2) Sterling May. Also known as Polly Johnson. Went to Johnson Co, Arkansas.

locations.evidence: Witness to 1809 deed with father-in-law Hudson Johnson

new_people_to_create.evidence: 1809 deed witness; married Mary Johnson daughter of Hudson
new_people_to_create.notes: First husband of Mary Johnson (daughter of Hudson Johnson). Witnessed 1809 deed alongside Hudson Johnson.

locations.evidence: Son stated family was 'of Bedford County, Virginia'

new_people_to_create.evidence: St. Martin of Tours Church records, Louisiana; son's statement
new_people_to_create.notes: Married (1) Humphrey Hogan c.1769, (2) William Hines. Son Charles Jonson Hogan married Sara HATCHER - key Hatcher connection. 'Possibly relative of Walter Johnson of Sullivan County, Tennessee' per researcher note. Living 1804.

new_people_to_create.evidence: Louisiana church records citing son Charles
new_people_to_create.notes: Married Rebecca Johnson c.1769. Died 1789 or 1790, probably leaving children not yet adults. Parentage unknown - research ongoing.

locations.evidence: Stated he was 'of Bedford County, Virginia'

new_people_to_create.evidence: St. Martin of Tours Church records, Louisiana
new_people_to_create.notes: Son of Humphrey Hogan and Rebecca Johnson. Married Sara HATCHER. Daughters Prudence (b.1806) and Anne (b.1808) baptized Louisiana. KEY HATCHER CONNECTION.

new_people_to_create.evidence: St. Martin of Tours Church records, Louisiana
new_people_to_create.notes: HATCHER - wife of Charles Jonson Hogan, son of Rebecca Johnson. Connects Johnson and Hatcher families. Daughters Prudence and Anne.
Married Olivia Renfro (daughter of James Renfro, born 1809). Another Johnson-Renfro marriage connection.
Daughter of James Renfro. Married Larkin Johnson.

locations.evidence: Wife's land deeds; buried Cannon Cemetery on Tumbling Creek

new_people_to_create.dna_notes: DNA match to descendants of Timothy Rich of Henrico Co VA
new_people_to_create.evidence: Humphreys Co TN deeds; cemetery records
new_people_to_create.notes: Married Margaret (b.1793 NC). Margaret did all land buying/selling - possibly couldn't write. Died 20 Nov 1844. Buried Cannon Cemetery, Tumbling Creek. Sons include James David Johnson, Jackson Johnson (born Kentucky). DNA matches Timothy Rich line.

locations.evidence: Multiple land deeds in her name 1826-1849

new_people_to_create.evidence: Humphreys Co TN deeds; cemetery records
new_people_to_create.notes: Wife of Hiram Johnson. Born NC, maiden name unknown. Educated - could sign her name. Did all land transactions (possibly Hiram couldn't write). Bought 50 acres 1826 for 1 cent/acre, 150 acres 1842. Buried Cannon Cemetery, Tumbling Creek. Partnership with son David Johnson 1849 for farming/stock raising.

new_people_to_create.evidence: Humphreys Co TN Deed Book M:169-171
new_people_to_create.notes: Son of Hiram Johnson and Margaret Johnson. Entered farming/stock partnership with mother Margaret 1849. Petitioned to sell mother's estate land 1854.

locations.evidence: Security for Benjamin Johnson estate 1744; tithables list 1746

new_people_to_create.evidence: 1721 Hanover Co road order; 1744 Goochland Co estate record; 1746 tithables
new_people_to_create.notes: Early Virginia Johnson. On 1721 road order with Thomas Johnson, John Bunch, David Meriwether. Posted security for Benjamin Johnson estate 1744. Listed on John Payne's tithables list 1746.
Lived in Dickson County TN. Possibly related to Nathaniel Johnson. Died c.1820. Son Isaac Johnson went to Johnson County, Arkansas about same time as Mary Polly Johnson Shropshire.

Died intestate before 1744. Widow Elizabeth Johnson administered estate. Isaac Johnson posted security. Appraisers included George Payne and Robert Burton Jr. (Burton family connection). Estate valued at 34 pounds, 9 shillings, 6 pence.

relationships_to_add.evidence_summary: Tony L. Johnson's direct ancestor statement; Big Creek Baptist Church records
Tony's research notes; Joel Shropshire (Mary's husband) witnessed deed with Hudson
Louisiana church records: 'Charles Jonson Hogans, son of Homfrey and Rebecca Jonson Hogan'
Researcher note: Rebecca Johnson 'possibly relative of Walter Johnson of Sullivan County, Tennessee'
Humphreys Co TN deeds; 1854 petition identifies Hiram as father
1854 petition: 'James David Johnson is Petitioning to sell land of Margaret Johnson decd. in right of their father Hiram Johnson'
Isaac posted security for Benjamin's estate - often indicates kinship

locations_to_create.name: Tumbling Creek
locations_to_create.description: Creek of the Duck River. Location of Hiram and Margaret Johnson lands. Cannon Cemetery on Ben Pewett farm.

locations_to_create.name: Rices Branch
locations_to_create.description: Branch of Tumbling Creek where Margaret Johnson received 150 acre state grant 1842.

locations_to_create.name: Cannon Cemetery
locations_to_create.description: Cemetery on Ben Pewett farm on Tumbling Creek. Burial place of Hiram Johnson (d.1844), Margaret Johnson (d.1850), Milbury Johnson (d.1869), George Washington Johnson.

locations_to_create.name: St. Martinville
locations_to_create.description: Location of St. Martin of Tours Church where Charles Jonson Hogan and Sara Hatcher had children baptized 1806-1808.

locations_to_create.name: Taylors Creek
locations_to_create.description: Creek where Isaac Johnson, Thomas Johnson, and John Bunch lived per 1721 road order. Part of Owens Creek area.
locations_to_create.notes: Tony notes: Meriwether families here married to Col. Richard Johnson son of William Johnson

locations_to_create.name: Buffalo Creek
locations_to_create.description: Location associated with Hudson Johnson and Agnes Johnson family per Tony's header notes.

research_questions_to_add.question: Is Rebecca Johnson related to Walter Johnson of Sullivan County?
research_questions_to_add.evidence_for: Researcher note states Rebecca Johnson 'possibly relative of Walter Johnson of Sullivan County, Tennessee'
research_questions_to_add.research_action: Compare Bedford County VA Johnson records with Sullivan County TN Johnson records

research_questions_to_add.question: What is Sara Hatcher's connection to the Henrico County Hatcher family?
research_questions_to_add.evidence_for: Hatcher surname; husband's family from Bedford County VA (near Henrico migration path)
research_questions_to_add.research_action: Research Hatcher families who migrated from Virginia to Louisiana; check for connections to Ben Hatcher of Henrico/Goochland

research_questions_to_add.question: What is Hiram Johnson's parentage and connection to Timothy Rich line?
research_questions_to_add.evidence_for: DNA match to descendants of Timothy Rich of Henrico Co VA
research_questions_to_add.research_action: Research Timothy Rich descendants; check for migration to Tennessee

research_questions_to_add.question: Is Isaac Johnson of Goochland (1721-1746) related to Benjamin Johnson whose estate he secured?
research_questions_to_add.evidence_for: Isaac posted security for Benjamin's estate - often indicates kinship
research_questions_to_add.research_action: Search Goochland County records for Isaac Johnson and Benjamin Johnson connections

research_questions_to_add.question: What is the connection between Eleanor Renfro who married John Johnson and Eleanor Renfro who married John R. Choate?
research_questions_to_add.evidence_for: Both born c.1775; both married men named John; overlapping geography (Montgomery Co VA and Dickson Co TN on same migration path)
research_questions_to_add.evidence_against: Different death dates (1833 vs 1845); different husbands' surnames; second Eleanor's parents identified as Isaac Alexander Renfro and Mary McKinney
research_questions_to_add.research_action: Determine if same person with two husbands (John Johnson died first), or two different women, or misattribution

key_findings: AGNES JOHNSON - wife of Hudson Johnson, Big Creek Baptist Church member - completes Tony's direct ancestral family
HUDSON JOHNSON served as deacon at Big Creek Baptist Church c.1800
Mary Johnson (Polly) - daughter of Hudson, married Joel Shropshire, later Sterling May
SARA HATCHER married Charles Jonson Hogan (son of Rebecca Johnson) - KEY HATCHER CONNECTION
Rebecca Johnson (c.1750-1804+) married Humphrey Hogan - 'possibly relative of Walter Johnson of Sullivan County'
Walter Johnson on 1788 Sullivan Co militia; 1796 tax shows 260 acres, Esquire title, 3 enslaved persons
Larkin Johnson married Olivia Renfro - another Johnson-Renfro marriage
HIRAM JOHNSON of Humphreys Co TN - DNA match to Timothy Rich line of Henrico Co VA
Margaret Johnson (wife of Hiram) did all land transactions - educated woman
ISAAC JOHNSON on 1721 road order with Thomas Johnson, John Bunch, David Meriwether
Isaac Johnson posted security for Benjamin Johnson estate 1744 - Robert Burton Jr. was appraiser (Burton connection)
Isaac Johnson of Dickson Co TN - connected to Nathaniel Johnson network, son went to Arkansas
